Module QemuJuicy
Package qemujuicy

Class AppProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,​V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<Object,​Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • qemujuicy.AppProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,​Object>
    public class AppProperties
extends Properties
    Application properties. Note: Do not forget to handle additional properties if a new release is going to be rolled out.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • pathname

        private String pathname

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppProperties

        public AppProperties​(String pathname,
                     boolean useXmlFile)
              throws Exception
        Construction from file or it takes the default values. The default values are written to the file (and may be overwritten later).
        Parameters:
        pathname - the path to the properties file
        useXmlFile - if true, use loadFromXML(), key/value pairs using load() otherwise
        Throws:
        Exception

    • Method Detail

      • checkDefaults

        private void checkDefaults()
        Check if all properties for this release are present, the user may use an older release.

      • checkProperty

        private void checkProperty​(String key,
                           String value)
        Check if a property for this release is present, the user may use an older release.

      • createDefaults

        protected void createDefaults()
        Creates the default properties. A subclass may overwrite this method.

        public String getPathname()
        Returns:
        the pathname

        public boolean getPropertyBool​(String key)
        Gets an boolean property (a flag).
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        true id the value is "true", false otherwise

      • setPropertyAndStoreXml

        public void setPropertyAndStoreXml​(String key,
                                   String value)
        Sets a property and update XML file by storing it, used as a convenience method.
        Parameters:
        key -
        value -

      • store

        public void store()
           throws FileNotFoundException,
                  IOException
        Store the properties to the key/value properties file, to persist them.
        Throws:
        IOException
        FileNotFoundException

      • storeToXML

        public void storeToXML()
        Store the properties into a XML properties file, to persist them. The property keys are sorted before, due to the readability of the file.
